title.narrative: 7.2 IMPROVED POLICIES, COORDINATION, SYS

description.narrative: Improved policies, strategies, coordination, systems and capacity for social policies and protection of the most vulnerable children by 2019, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 7.0 Improved policy environment and systems for disadvantaged and excluded children, guided by improved knowledge and data by 2019.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved policies, strategies, coordination, systems and capacity for social policies and protection of the most vulnerablechildren by 2019

description.narrative: The involvement of the Office of the Vice President in the first Inter-Agency Forum on Social Protection galvanized key stakeholders in the dialogue on social protection and opened up space to lobby for the inclusion of child grants in the Social Protection initiatives in the country. The meeting concluded with the endorsement of critical deliverables on social protection which are influencing the strategic level discussions in the country. This provides political support to develop improved policies, strategies, coordination and systems for social policies and protection of the most vulnerable children in 2020. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020

title.narrative: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy that addresses children needs(47863)

target.value: 2019:Updated Social Protection strategy that reflects the current Social protection policy

actual.value: 2019:The reviewed Sierra Leone National Social Protection policy has been signed by the Minster of Labour. The update of the strategy to reflect the revised policy will happen next year.
